definition: trusted/intimate/(of the emperor) to visit/variant of 幸[xing4]
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: Even criminal cases are not immune.
sentences.chinese: 甚至犯罪案件也不能幸免。
树活下来了，他也幸免于难。

sentences.english: The train went off the rails and fell into the vally, killing everyone on board.
sentences.chinese: 火车出了轨，掉到峡谷下，车上无一人幸免于难。

sentences.english: They think that if they had a mother with diabetes, they're doomed to have it to.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为如果母亲有糖尿病，那自己也幸免不了。

sentences.english: By then I realised that my survival was a miracle.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我才意识到我的幸免遇难是个奇迹。

sentences.english: He knows they must be at their best to survive.
sentences.chinese: 他知道大家只有保持最佳状态才能幸免于难。

sentences.english: Only two passengers survived the air-crash.
sentences.chinese: 这次飞机失事只有两名乘客幸免于死。

sentences.english: Vegetarians may think that they’re immune, but they’re not.
sentences.chinese: 素食主义者或许认为他们是幸免者，但事实并非如此。

sentences.english: Aside of schadenfreude SuiYu, didnt also able to survive, Allah is often come in.
sentences.chinese: 一旁幸灾乐祸的隋玉，也没能幸免，被常安拉了进来。

sentences.english: Small fine sword hand attacks, thanks to strong home bailed to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小嘉被刀手袭击，幸得家强出手拯救才幸免于难。

sentences.english: If your neighbor ends up in a blacklist, you will too.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的邻居被拉进黑名单，你也无法幸免。

sentences.english: Bautista, who survived the attack, was brought to this hospital.
sentences.chinese: 包蒂斯塔在这次袭击中幸免于难，被送到这家医院。

sentences.english: I do not think altogether the worse for a book for having survived the author a generation or two.
sentences.chinese: 一两代作家的书的差距本人以为完整不克不及幸免。

sentences.english: All of North America is in recession now.
sentences.chinese: 北美所有地区无一幸免地陷入衰退。

sentences.english: British suffered heavy snow hit the same time, the European continent, can not escape.
sentences.chinese: 英国遭遇大雪袭击的同时，欧洲大陆各国也未能幸免。

definition: violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
to meet violent death/to get killed
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
